705805f-b.text:
Myrtle Avenue, north side, east from St. Edwards Street to North Elliott Place. The corner house is a very old dwelling. These buildings will be torn down and on their site erected the Fort Greene Houses, a low-rent housing project.
View 1: October 12, 1940.
View 2,3: September 6, 1939
P. L. Sperr
View 3 shows the frame house on the corner, seen from North Elliott Place.
705805f-b.folder: Myrtle Avenue & St. Edward's Street, Brooklyn, NY
705805f-b.original_title: Brooklyn: Myrtle Avenue - St. Edward's Street

706574f-b.text:
St. Edwards Street, north from Myrtle Avenue. View 1 shows
the east side of the avenue with the south wing of Public School
No. 67 on the extreme left and the New Cumberland Hospital in the
right background; view 2 shows the west side of the street and St.
Edwards Roman Catholic Church, at Leo Place.
October 12, 1940
Views 1,2
View 3: October 10, 1940
P. L. Sperr
View 3 is north on St. Edwards Street, across
Myrtle Avenue, from Fort Greene Park.
706574f-b.original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Myrtle Avenue
